entry.tran: (尤指用于制作大衣或毛毯的)带毛的羊皮，羊毛皮革
entry.def: Sheepskin is the skin of a sheep with the wool still attached to it, used especially for making coats and rugs.

means.word_mean: 1. tanned skin of a sheep with the fleece left on; used for clothing
2. skin of a sheep or goat prepared for writing on
3. a document certifying the successful completion of a course of study

Sentence.sentence: Printing with moveable type on paper dramatically reduced the cost of producing a book compared with the old-fashioned ones handwritten on vellum, which comes from sheepskin.
A Bible—to be sure, a long book—required vellum made from 300 sheepskins and countless man-hours of labor.
